text: Welcome <@U0997HN7KPE>! Under his non-Bitsafe email :white_check_mark:

Hi team – quick update from the Tokenomics meeting:

They're setting up an Accountability Committee to review how Featured Apps are operating. Each app will get the same set of standard questions, and the committee will put together a report based on the answers. We’ll be able to present our results as part of that process.

Chris mentioned we won’t need to go into implementation details like what billing system we use.

The committee will follow a few core principles:
• Apply guidelines consistently
• Review regular updates from apps, and status reporting on results
• Explain how rewards are allocated and what weights are used
• Work with app teams to share best practices
PS - And, Chris Z apologized for being too harsh last week. That was very grand of him

elements.text:
Hi team – quick update from the Tokenomics meeting:

They're setting up an Accountability Committee to review how Featured Apps are operating. Each app will get the same set of standard questions, and the committee will put together a report based on the answers. We’ll be able to present our results as part of that process.

Chris mentioned we won’t need to go into implementation details like what billing system we use.

The committee will follow a few core principles:
Review regular updates from apps, and status reporting on results
Explain how rewards are allocated and what weights are used
Work with app teams to share best practices
PS - And, Chris Z apologized for being too harsh last week. That was very grand of him

text:
<@U05FZBDQ4RJ> Ah, ok I got a big summary from a Denex team member here: <https://bit-safe.slack.com/archives/C08K01FMFJT/p1754500478354959>

I will go through this and see what we can do to optitmize

elements.text:
, you can see in the dashboard your daily usage levels and your rolling 7 day average. Currently, iBTC is using around ~100 MB/day, which is reflected in the dashboard. There have been no traffic purchases because your validator traffic balance is currently above the minimum balance of 500kb. The gas station will purchase traffic once it drops below the minimum.

However, your validator is purchasing traffic directly so the gas station does not have a chance to purchase traffic on your behalf. This implies the auto-top up setting on your validator is still on and set to a high value. For the gas station to purchase traffic, you'll need to update your Auto Top-up Configuration settings in your validator to the suggested values in our onboarding documentation (page 3). This way, your validator will only purchase traffic as a backup mechanism to the gas station.

Here are the recommended next steps:

Update iBTC's Auto-top up configuration settings on the validator to prevent direct traffic purchases. This way, Denex will begin to purchase traffic on your behalf. At the current usage levels, that puts iBTC in the Active-Pro profile tier, enabling you to earn 4x the amount of rewards you're currently earning (thus discounting your traffic at an even higher rate!)

Update your minimum traffic balance threshold to at least 5,000KB (5MB). Since the daily usage is around 100MB that implies an hourly usage of around ~4MB. Therefore, a safe bet would be to set your minimum traffic balance to 5,000KB to ensure your validator has enough traffic to accomodate your usage.

Once your auto-top up config values are changed, and your minimum balance threshold updated, the gas station will begin purchasing traffic on your behalf as often as iBTC dips below the minimum threshold of 5MB.

Let us know if you'd like support in getting these values updated! Happy to schedule a call with our engineers to help get this sorted. cc:

For the gas station to purchase traffic, you'll need to update your Auto Top-up Configuration settings in your validator to the suggested values in our onboarding documentation (page 3). Let us know if you'd like support in getting these values updated! Happy to schedule a call with our engineers to help get this sorted. cc: <@U08FCND9P1Q>

Hi <@U05FU0HPZ9T>, you can see in the dashboard your daily usage levels and your rolling 7 day average. Currently, iBTC is using around ~100 MB/day, which is reflected in the dashboard. There have been no traffic purchases because your validator traffic balance is currently above the minimum balance of 500kb. The gas station will purchase traffic once it drops below the minimum.

However, your validator is purchasing traffic directly so the gas station does not have a chance to purchase traffic on your behalf. This implies the auto-top up setting on your validator is still on and set to a high value. For the gas station to purchase traffic, you'll need to update your Auto Top-up Configuration settings in your validator to the suggested values in our onboarding documentation (page 3). This way, your validator will only purchase traffic as a backup mechanism to the gas station.

Here are the recommended next steps:
1. Update iBTC's Auto-top up configuration settings on the validator to prevent direct traffic purchases. This way, Denex will begin to purchase traffic on your behalf. At the current usage levels, that puts iBTC in the Active-Pro profile tier, enabling you to earn 4x the amount of rewards you're currently earning (thus discounting your traffic at an even higher rate!)
2. Update your minimum traffic balance threshold to at least 5,000KB (5MB). Since the daily usage is around 100MB that implies an hourly usage of around ~4MB. Therefore, a safe bet would be to set your minimum traffic balance to 5,000KB to ensure your validator has enough traffic to accomodate your usage. 
Once your auto-top up config values are changed, and your minimum balance threshold updated, the gas station will begin purchasing traffic on your behalf as often as iBTC dips below the minimum threshold of 5MB.

Let us know if you'd like support in getting these values updated! Happy to schedule a call with our engineers to help get this sorted. cc: <@U08FCND9P1Q>
